dublinCore.dc:title: 116 S100 IS: Repealing Big Brother Overreach Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Tuberville (for himself, Mr. Cruz, Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Moreno, Ms. Lummis, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Boozman, Mr. Scott of Florida, Mr. Sullivan, Mrs. Fischer, Mr. Sheehy, Mr. Tillis, Mr. Budd, Mr. Paul, Mr. Hagerty, Mr. Cramer, Mrs. Hyde-Smith, Mr. Lankford, Mr. Marshall, Mr. Schmitt, Mr. Barrasso, Mr. Daines, Mr. Risch, Mr. Young, and Mr. Lee) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To repeal the Corporate Transparency Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Repealing Big Brother Overreach Act.

subsection.text: The Corporate Transparency Act (title LXIV of division F of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 134 Stat. 4604)) and the amendments made by that Act are repealed.

paragraph.text: Title 31, United States Code, is amended—

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking sections 5314, 5315, and 5336 each place the term appears and inserting sections 5314 and 5315; and
in paragraph (6), by striking (except section 5336) each place the term appears; and

subparagraph.text: in section 5322, by striking section 5315, 5324, or 5336 each place the term appears and inserting section 5315 or 5324.

paragraph.text: Title LXV of the Anti-Money Laundering Act of 2020 (division F of the of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 134 Stat. 4604)) is amended—

clause.text: by striking (a) In general.—Subsection (l) and inserting Subsection (l); and
